country.name: Brazil
country.overview: Brazil, a vast South American country, stretches from the Amazon Basin in the north to vineyards and massive Iguaçu Falls in the south. Rio de Janeiro, symbolized by its 38m Christ the Redeemer statue atop Mount Corcovado, is famed for its busy Copacabana and Ipanema beaches as well as its enormous, raucous Carnaval festival, featuring parade floats, flamboyant costumes, and samba music and dance.

geography.location_description: Eastern South America, bordering the Atlantic Ocean
geography.climate: mostly tropical, but temperate in south
geography.terrain: mostly flat to rolling lowlands in north; some plains, hills, mountains, and narrow coastal belt
geography.hazards: recurring droughts in northeast; floods and occasional frost in south
geography.notes: largest country in South America and in the Southern Hemisphere; shares common boundaries with every South American country except Chile and Ecuador

languages.name: Serbian
